title: Thousands trapped without water in Haitian capital, official says
description: Thousands of Haitians are trapped in capital city Port-au-Prince without access to water, food or other essential supplies, according to aid groups and a local official.

title: Astronomers detect mysterious radio bursts with a 'heartbeat' pattern in space
description: Astronomers revealed they've come across a mysterious radio burst signal from a galaxy around a billion light-years away with a pattern similar to a heartbeat. CNN's Tom Foreman explains what it could be.

title: 'Dark Matter' author says his new book, already being adapted into a film, isn't just an 'alarm bell'
description: The ability to enhance your body is everywhere today: wearable tech to help you sleep better or exercise more efficiently, "smart drugs" to sharpen your focus and memory recall, injectable fillers to tweak the features of your face, genetic testing to identify and mitigate potential health risks.

title: A Mexican network is smuggling abortion drugs to American women
description: One day late last month, as new abortion restrictions began taking shape in US states, three Mexican women quietly crossed into the country at different points along the border, dozens of abortion-inducing pills hidden in their belongings.

title: Why Palestinians are pessimistic about Biden's visit
description: In spite of the Biden administration's renewed financing in the Palestinian territories, many Palestinians are pessimistic about the President's visit because of the perceived unwillingness to pressure Israel over continued expansion of West Bank settlements and other key issues. CNN's Hadas Gold has more.

title: Perseverance rover scouts spot for 1st mission that will launch from Mars
description: The Perseverance rover now has a new job: acting as a location scout on Mars.

title: TikTok announces new ways to filter out mature or 'potentially problematic' videos
description: TikTok on Wednesday announced several updates intended to help users customize their viewing preferences and filter out content that may be problematic or too mature for young users, amid renewed scrutiny of the potential harms social media poses to teens.

title: Fist bumps instead of handshakes: Biden tries to 'minimize contact' in Israel and Saudi Arabia
description: President Joe Biden was greeted in Israel on Wednesday by a row of Israeli leaders offering open palms to the President.

title: Doctors worry that online misinformation will push abortion-seekers toward ineffective, dangerous methods
description: After a US Supreme Court draft decision on Roe v. Wade was leaked in May, Dr. Joshua Trebach noticed a disturbing turn in the online conversation around abortion.

title: Turpin children "failed" by Southern California social services, report says
description: The social services system "failed" and further harmed 13 children who were rescued in 2018 after being starved and tortured by their parents for years in Southern California, according to an independent report presented Tuesday to the Riverside County Board of Supervisors.

title: Chris Hemsworth stopped eating meat before filming a kiss with vegan 'Thor' costar Natalie Portman
description: Chris Hemsworth is every bit as super offscreen as the Marvel hero he plays, according to his fellow actors -- even ditching his daily dose of meat before shooting a scene in which he kissed his vegan costar in "Thor: Love and Thunder," Natalie Portman.

title: A terrifying glimpse of what could await America after the 2024 election
description: As the January 6 House select committee conducted its most dramatic hearing yet on Tuesday, the nation witnessed a tragic accounting of how then-President Donald Trump propelled his followers toward the lethal mob attack on the Capitol. Today, little doubt should be attached to the notion that he knew his cause was false as he tried to defy the standard of democracy -- the voters' will -- so that he could remain the most powerful person in the world.

title: LA District Attorney says Roman Polanski case transcripts should be unsealed
description: Los Angeles County District Attorney George Gascón announced Tuesday that he will no longer object to unsealing transcripts related to director Roman Polanski's decades-old sexual assault case.

title: Why requiring workers to spend more days in the office could backfire
description: Before the pandemic, many corporate leaders believed that allowing their employees to work from home would hurt productivity. But, in many cases, the pandemic proved otherwise.

title: What John Bolton gets wrong about coup attempts -- and Donald Trump
description: In an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper on Tuesday, John Bolton, who served as national security adviser under former President Donald Trump, made an interesting argument: Trump and those around him simply weren't sophisticated enough for the January 6 riot at the US Capitol to be rightly read as a coup attempt.

title: Champagne bottle sells for record $2.5 million
description: A bottle of Champagne has sold for $2.5 million, eclipsing the auction record for bubbly and likely becoming the most expensive bottle of wine ever sold.

title: Google becomes the latest tech giant to slow hiring
description: Google plans to slow its pace of hiring for the remainder of the year in the latest sign of tech companies rethinking staffing amid a market downturn that has hit Silicon Valley particularly hard.

title: Farmer shows 'deadly crop' left on his farm by Russian military
description: A farmer in Mykolaiv, Ukraine, collected Russian rockets and nose cones found on his farm fields in recent weeks, as farmers continue to harvest and store wheat and grain despite Russia's naval blockades of Ukraine's ports. CNN's Ivan Watson reports from the farm.

title: Inflation surges by 9.1%, driven by record gas prices
description: Inflation surged to a new pandemic-era peak in June, with US consumer prices jumping by 9.1% year-over-year, according to fresh data released Wednesday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Spain to introduce free train journeys from September
description: Public transport prices on state-owned service across Spain have already been slashed in half in response to rapidly rising energy and inflation rates. Now the government has announced further 100% discounts.

title: Here's what life is like in Sri Lanka in the midst of its economic crisis
Pete Davidson wants to have a kid: 'That's like my dream'
description: Pete Davidson is looking forward to fatherhood someday.

title: Irish sprinter denied entry to Commonwealth Games, according to CNN affiliate News18
description: Irish sprinter Leon Reid has been barred from participating in the 2022 Commonwealth Games following a "security risk assessment," according to a statement from the Commonwealth Games provided to CNN affiliate CNN-News18.

title: What the heck happened to the Gap?
description: In 1969, real estate investor Don Fisher opened a store in San Francisco aimed at teens and college kids, offering Levi's blue jeans and record tapes.

title: Mysterious fast radio burst in space has a 'heartbeat' pattern
description: A mysterious radio burst with a pattern similar to a heartbeat has been detected in space.

title: 'Kite Runner' author Khaled Hosseini says his daughter has come out as transgender -- and he's 'never been prouder'
description: Acclaimed writer Khaled Hosseini has said he has "never been prouder" of his daughter, after she came out as transgender.

title: Delta earnings fall far short of expectations because of high fuel costs and service problems
description: Delta Air Lines earned its biggest profit since the start of the pandemic in its latest quarter, but higher fuel costs, labor issues and service problems caused it to earn far less than investors expected.

title: New giant lion statue on Indian parliament building sparks political spat
description: A statue of India's national emblem, unveiled this week atop the country's new parliament, has been slammed by government critics for its "unnecessarily aggressive" appearance.

title: How Sri Lanka's runaway President went from 'war hero' to fugitive
'Series of malfunctions' behind Champions League final chaos, according to French Senate
description: The French Senate cleared Liverpool fans of any responsibility in the Champions League Final chaos, instead blaming French decision-making, two senators told journalists in a press conference Wednesday presenting conclusions of a report on the violence.

title: 'I don't have hope': Palestinian man doubts impact of Biden's Middle East trip
description: CNN's Hadas Gold speaks to Israelis and Palestinians ahead of President Biden's visit to Jerusalem and Bethlehem, to get their impressions of current US engagement in the region.

title: Best places in Europe to visit: A modern-day Grand Tour
description: The Grand Tour was a rite of passage for men and women of certain wealth and status in the late 18th and early 19th centuries, taking in the best Europe had to offer.

title: 'Where the Crawdads Sing' hits just enough of the right notes
description: Placing Daisy Edgar-Jones under the spotlight, "Where the Crawdads Sing" serves up a virtual symphony of chords -- adapting a bestselling book that's part wild-child tale, part romance, part mystery and part courtroom drama. The result effectively overcomes its Lifetime-movie vibe, without feeling like something anyone needs to rush to a theater to consume.

title: 3 reasons not to panic about decades-high inflation
description: When the latest data on consumer prices in the United States arrives today, the headline number is expected to be ugly.

title: See the mind-boggling decision this 'Jeopardy!' contestant made on the brink of victory
description: Harry Enten, John Berman, and Brianna Keilar discuss the poor decision a "Jeopardy!" contestant made that cost them the victory.

title: In pictures: Crisis in Sri Lanka
description: Protesters broke into the official residences of Sri Lanka's president and prime minister on Saturday as people were demonstrating over the country's worsening economic crisis.

title: Reality Check: Russia's 'fire hose of falsehood' propaganda
description: CNN's John Avlon looks at Vladimir Putin's recent gaslighting attempts as part of Russia's propaganda war against Ukraine.

title: Don't expect sword dances when Biden visits Saudi Arabia
description: From having "no redeeming social value" to being a "strategic partner" of the United States. That's how far Saudi Arabia has come in President Joe Biden's eyes since Russia's invasion of Ukraine saw oil prices soaring to eight-year highs.

title: Breakfast is back, but hotel guests have new grievances
description: After two pandemic years of high satisfaction with hotels -- thanks to good value, positive staff experiences, confidence in cleanliness and proactive communication -- things have taken a turn for the worse for hotel guests.

title: How Sri Lanka's President went from 'war hero' to fugitive
description:
• Protesters storm the Prime Minister's office and President flees
• Sri Lanka's crisis rages on. Here's what we know

title: How Putin's stranglehold of wheat ripples across the globe
description: As farmers across Ukraine attempt to bring in their wheat harvests in the coming weeks, it could be make-or-break for global food supplies.

title: California governor signs law allowing gun violence victims to sue firearm manufacturers for damages
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a law Tuesday that clears the path for gun violence victims to file civil suits against the companies that manufacture the firearms used in crimes.

title: China is a pacing challenge: Air Force chief of staff
description: US Gen. Charles Q. Brown, Jr. tells CNN's Christiane Amanpour about his efforts to reform the institution to address the rise of China in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: 2 dead, including a 7-year-old, after boat capsizes off New York City in the Hudson River
description: Two people died Tuesday afternoon after a boat capsized off New York City's Midtown Manhattan, spilling relatives and friends onboard into the Hudson River, officials said.

title: Heat wave threatens power shortages and higher pork prices in China
description: A scorching heat wave in China has forced a major manufacturing region to appeal to businesses and households to use less power, while fear of crop failure is sending pork prices soaring.

title: Why Brittney Griner is so valuable to Putin
description: Some of the most dramatic -- and diplomatically delicate -- moments in United States-Russia relations are linked to prisoner exchanges.

title: Shanghai orders mass testing of residents as new Covid variant detected
description: Millions of Shanghai residents braved sweltering heat Tuesday to wait in line for compulsory Covid tests, as growing case numbers and the emergence of a highly infectious Omicron subvariant spurred new fears of a return to mass lockdown.

title: The story behind this iconic golf shot
description: As a group of amateur golfers assemble on the first tee of the Old Course at St Andrews in Scotland, they are watched pensively by a man sat in the clubhouse pavilion.

title: As golf travels to its 'Home' for 150th Open, it's played against the backdrop of its biggest threat
description: Golf has come a long way since Willie Park Senior and Old Tom Morris, in a field of just eight players, competed in the first Open in 1860 at Prestwick.

title: Set bedtime back to prepare your child for kindergarten, study says
description: A backpack, lunch box, crayons and at least 10 hours of sleep each night are all things children need to get off to a good start in kindergarten, according to a new study.

title: US Navy destroyer performs freedom of navigation exercise in South China Sea
description: A US Navy destroyer sailed near a disputed South China Sea island chain on Wednesday, challenging the restrictions imposed by China and others on transit through the area.

title: Lego closes Russia business and lays off 90 staff in Moscow
description: Lego is closing its business in Russia indefinitely and laying off its 90 Moscow-based employees, owing to "extensive disruption" in the country, the Danish toymaker said on Tuesday.

title: Two exhausted armies are battling for eastern Ukraine. Can either of them strike a decisive blow?
description: When Vladimir Putin refocused his war in Ukraine on the country's east three months ago, he did so bruised by the failures of his initial lunge towards Kyiv and desperate for a face-saving success.

title: Uvalde school shooting surveillance video fuels scrutiny over a delayed law enforcement response
Cheney: Trump tried to contact Jan. 6 panel witness
Ivanka's former chief of staff contradicts reason why Ivanka was at the Jan. 6 rally
description: The House select committee investigating the Capitol insurrection presents contradicting video testimony from Ivanka Trump and her former chief of staff, Julie Radford, during their seventh hearing.

title: Uvalde City Council accepts Pete Arredondo's resignation
description: The Uvalde, Texas, City Council on Tuesday accepted the resignation of Councilman Pedro "Pete" Arredondo.

title: Watch: Introverted dogs' meetup has the internet in stitches
description: Introverted dogs have a hilarious meetup at a dog park and introverted humans relate. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Newspaper posts portions of video from Uvalde school shooting hallway ahead of official release
description: The Austin American-Statesman newspaper published Tuesday edited portions of surveillance video showing officers retreating from gunfire in the hallway of Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, during the fatal shooting there in May.

title: The US steps up its game as China circles the Pacific
description: On a small group of atolls in the central Pacific Ocean, Kiribati islanders celebrated their Independence Day Tuesday with a President who had skipped the region's first face-to-face meeting in three years.

title: The 2024 Republican race is no longer a slam dunk for Trump
description: For the better part of the last year, when people asked me whether I thought Donald Trump would be the Republican presidential nominee in 2024, the answer has been the same: If he runs, he will be.

title: Traveling reaches peak suck just as everyone is trying to get out of town
description: Editor's Note: This story is part of CNN Business' Nightcap newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up for free, here.
